content.description: Start in an overhanging open dihedral on good holds, pull up and through a more cruxy section on slopers, then stem and jug haul onto a ledge before pulling a couple of moves in a crack up high.
content.location: Somewhat alone between Fur Elise and Rock of Sages.  Look for lots of chalk.

content.description: Book calls it 10b, but it feels 10d without beta.  Lots of dead ends - have to traverse left and right at just the right points.
content.protection: PG13 only if leading from the ground - clipping the first bolt feels sketchier than most routes in the area. Fine with a stick-clip. Anchor is made up of joined chains.
content.location:
30-50' right of Shanked.

This is the route where the belayer has no place to be except on the trail.

content.description:
Big blocky jugs with 4 bolts at the bottom, then easier climbing higher up where you can run it out to the top.

UPDATE: Route needs a glue-in bolt and anchor. At the top there is only one bolt and a full anchor still needs to be added. Hence this route is unfinished. The top of the route is too far left to use the Shanked anchor. It's not recommended to climb this until more hardware gets added.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Small pro. No anchor. 1 bolt at the top out.
content.location: Located between Fur Elise and Shanked.

content.description: The crux is at the start. You can't clip the first bolt until you're about half way up over the starting rock, so best to have a spotter in case of a fall. It is a good boulder problem, but once you get past the start is more like a 5.8 to the top.
